snippet: Two Libertarian candidates were tossed from Ohio’s primary ballot on Friday by Secretary of State Jon Husted in a ruling that sparked immediate plans for a legal challenge.
abstract: Libertarian candidates Charlie Earl, running for governor, and Steven Linnabary, running for attorney general, are tossed from Ohio’s primary ballot by Sec of State Jon Husted in ruling that sparks plans for a legal challenge; Husted says their nominating petitions are challenged on two grounds.
lead_paragraph: Two Libertarian candidates were tossed from Ohio’s primary ballot on Friday by Secretary of State Jon Husted in a ruling that sparked immediate plans for a legal challenge.

headline.main: Ohio: Two Libertarians Removed From Ballot
headline.print_headline: Ohio: Two Libertarians Removed From Ballot
